body: Hill was a Philadelphia, Pennsylvania physician; however, there is little biographical information available for him.  Nothing is known of his art training; however, a newspaper account in the May 13, 1869 edition of the Philadelphia Daily Evening Bulletin regarded him as a “celebrated artist.”  This is supported by there are records of him having exhibited at the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts in 1849.
dimensions: Oil on canvas, 28.5 x 35.5 inches/Signed lower left
metaTitle: James S. Hill - Hunter with Dogs - 19th Century American Fine Art
metaDescription: Hunter with Dogs by James S. Hill: An evocative 19th-century American fine art piece that immerses you in the rugged beauty of the wilderness.
title: Hunter with Dogs
